content:
Now that emails notifications for streams has been merged, would it make sense to add a setting like the following?
pasted image
I don't understand what that would do.
I think that would send an email for every new message in a stream?

The use case is e.g. I joined a friend's Zulip. I'm interested in their Zulip, but most days the realm gets zero messages, so I'm not really going to remember to check it. I would love to basically just click a button and have every message in that realm sent to email.

The second use case is I'm considering starting a zulip for my house. I don't expect people will remember to check zulip though, so I want an easy thing everyone can do to get everything via email.

The third use case is to respond to "I hate all chat" arguments against moving projects to zulip. I think it's a huge benefit of zulip that it does bridge nicely with email. (I think that's actually way more important than bridging nicely with IRC). Right now we technically do but it's not obvious that we do.
And at a technical level, this would just force-set all streams to the "always email" state?
I've been pushing to refactor our notifications settings to handle things like this a little differently, but for now, yeah.
Sure, maybe we mean the default for streams they haven't explicitly set differently.
I think that's worth pursuing as a concept.
